item.title: What this government shutdown could cost
item.description: The longest shutdown in history, which lasted 34 days during President Donald Trump’s first term, cost the government about $11 billion.

item.title: Why Trump’s 2020 election loss lives on in the Georgia governor’s race
item.description: Warring factions at odds over his failed effort to overturn the outcome are renewing their rivalries in a major midterm contest.

item.title: We asked 1,000 Americans who is to blame for the shutdown. Here’s what they said.
item.description: More Americans blame Trump and Republicans than Democrats for shutdown, poll finds.

item.title: Democrats are putting money into solidly red Mississippi. Here’s why.
item.description: The DNC is investing in low-profile state races there as the South is on track to wield more power in future elections. Will it work?

item.title: Kash Patel ends FBI partnership with the Anti-Defamation League
item.description: The FBI director’s move follows conservative backlash against the ADL, which had described Charlie Kirk’s Turning Point USA as a platform for extremis...
